snippet: The state’s tentative agreement with public employee unions eases changes facing some state workers under a sweeping 2011 law intended to control spiraling pension costs.
abstract: Rhode Island and representatives of its public employees, brokered by federal mediators, reach deal to soften some provisions in 2011 law intended to control spiraling cost of state’s pension system; state’s retirement board approves agreement, seeking to end legal challenges by public employee unions to 2011 law, as well as to pension-related laws passed in 2009 and 2010.
lead_paragraph: The state’s tentative agreement with public employee unions eases changes facing some state workers under a sweeping 2011 law intended to control spiraling pension costs.

headline.main: Rhode Island Reaches Deal to Soften Pension Changes
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island Reaches Deal to Soften Pension Changes
